title: FitVerse AI — Futuristic AI Fashion E-Commerce Platform Frontend

requirements.summary: Apply glassmorphism UI design system with purple/blue/pink gradients, animated backgrounds, glowing buttons, and smooth transitions
acceptanceCriteria: All pages render with glassmorphism card/panel styles (frosted glass effect with blur and translucency)
Background shows animated gradient mesh or particle effect on all pages
Buttons glow and scale on hover with smooth transitions
Typography feels futuristic and clean (e.g., sharp sans-serif with gradient text accents)
Color palette consistently uses purple, neon blue, and pink gradients
Page-to-page transitions use smooth fade or slide animations

file_operations.description: Add glassmorphism utility classes, gradient text classes, glow effects, and keyframe animations for buttons and backgrounds. Define CSS custom properties for purple (#9333EA), neon blue (#06B6D4), and pink (#EC4899) with gradient combinations. Add backdrop-blur, frosted glass, and shadow utilities. Include smooth transition defaults and page transition animations.

Extend theme with custom colors (purple-neon, blue-neon, pink-neon), glassmorphism plugin or utilities, custom shadows for glow effects, animation configs for button hover, and transition timing functions for smooth page transitions.

Create a component that renders an animated gradient mesh background using the generated gradient-mesh-bg.dim_1920x1080.png image from frontend/public/assets/generated/gradient-mesh-bg.dim_1920x1080.png as a base layer with CSS animations or canvas-based particle effects overlaid. Apply fixed positioning to cover all pages.
Create a reusable glassmorphism card component with backdrop-blur, translucent background, border with gradient, and soft shadow. Accept className prop for customization.

requirements.summary: Create floating animated sidebar navigation with links to Landing, Shop, Trial Hub, Body Scan AI, and Wardrobe AI
acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar floats on screen and is visible across all pages
Each nav item highlights with a neon glow on hover
Active page is clearly indicated with a glowing accent
Sidebar collapses to icons on narrow viewports
Navigation between all 5 pages works correctly

file_operations.description: Create a floating sidebar component with nav links to /, /shop, /trial-hub, /body-scan, and /wardrobe. Use React Router's NavLink for active state detection. Apply glassmorphism styling, neon glow on hover, and responsive collapse to icon-only on mobile. Include micro-animations using CSS transitions or Framer Motion.

Import and render Sidebar component as a persistent navigation element. Wrap routes with AnimatedBackground component. Set up React Router with routes for Landing (/), Shop (/shop), Trial Hub (/trial-hub), Body Scan AI (/body-scan), and Wardrobe AI (/wardrobe). Ensure Sidebar is rendered outside route outlet so it persists across pages.

requirements.summary: Build Landing Page with hero headline, subheadline, three CTAs, and animated AI avatar illustration
acceptanceCriteria: Hero headline renders prominently with gradient text styling
Subheadline is concise and clearly communicates three AI features
All three CTA buttons navigate to the correct pages
Animated avatar illustration plays continuously (CSS or JS animation)
Landing page has no sidebar or uses a minimal top nav variant

file_operations.description: Create Landing page component with hero section containing headline 'Shop Smart. Try Smart. Dress Smart.' styled with gradient text, a subheadline describing AI-powered trial hub, body scan, and wardrobe intelligence, and three CTA buttons ('Start Shopping' → /shop, 'Scan My Body' → /body-scan, 'Scan My Wardrobe' → /wardrobe). Include the animated AI avatar using the generated image frontend/public/assets/generated/ai-avatar-hero.dim_600x700.png with CSS animation (floating or pulse effect). Apply glassmorphism styling to hero card. Hide Sidebar on this page or use conditional rendering.

requirements.summary: Build Shop Page with product grid (10+ items), size selectors, AI fit confidence badges, trial cart (max 5 items), and warning popups for size/wardrobe mismatches
acceptanceCriteria: Product grid displays at least 10 items with category labels
Each card shows image, name, price, size selector, fit confidence badge, and Add to Trial button
After 5 items added, all remaining Add to Trial buttons are disabled with a visual indicator
Trial Cart side panel updates in real time as items are added
Send to Trial Hub button navigates to Trial Hub page and passes selected items
Size warning popup appears when a size mismatching the body scan recommendation is selected
Wardrobe duplicate ownership popup appears correctly based on wardrobe scan state

file_operations.description: Create Shop page component that fetches products from backend using getAllProducts() on mount. Render a responsive product grid with at least 10 items. Each product card displays image, name, price, size selector (XS/S/M/L/XL radio or dropdown), AI Fit Confidence % badge, and 'Add to Trial' button. Use shared app state (from context) to manage trial cart items (max 5). Disable all Add to Trial buttons once 5 items are selected. Check body scan recommended size state and show warning popup if selected size mismatches. Check wardrobe data state and show ownership duplicate popup if product category/color matches existing items. Render Trial Cart side panel component.

Create ProductCard component accepting product data, size selection handler, and Add to Trial handler. Render glassmorphism card with product image, name, price, size selector, fit confidence badge, and Add to Trial button with glow effect. Disable button if trial cart is full or item already added.

Create TrialCart side panel component that displays selected trial items from shared state. Show each item with image, name, and selected size. Include a 'Send to Trial Hub' button that navigates to /trial-hub. Apply glassmorphism styling and slide-in animation.

Create a dialog component that displays size mismatch warning: 'This size may not fit you. Recommended: M'. Accept open state, onClose handler, and recommended size as props. Use glassmorphism styling and glow effects.

Create a dialog component that displays wardrobe duplicate warning: 'You already own 5 pink tops. Are you sure you want another?'. Accept open state, onClose handler, and ownership message as props. Use glassmorphism styling.

requirements.summary: Build Trial Hub Page displaying up to 5 selected items with Keep/Return buttons and animated confirmation effects
acceptanceCriteria: All selected trial items are displayed with image and size
Keep button turns card green with 'Purchased' label and plays a confirmation animation
Return button turns card red with 'Returned' label and plays a confirmation animation
Both buttons are disabled after a decision is made for that item
State persists within the session (not lost on navigation within the app)

file_operations.description: Create Trial Hub page component that reads selected trial items from shared app state. Render each item with product image, name, selected size, 'Keep' button, and 'Return' button. Use local state to track each item's status (neutral/kept/returned). On Keep click, apply green highlight, show 'Purchased' label, play confirmation animation (scale pulse or checkmark), and disable both buttons. On Return click, apply red highlight, show 'Returned' label, play confirmation animation, and disable both buttons. Apply glassmorphism styling to item cards.

requirements.summary: Build Body Scan AI Page with simulated camera UI, scan animation, detected measurements, and recommended size result
acceptanceCriteria: Camera frame UI renders with a realistic simulated feed area
Scan animation plays for at least 2-3 seconds after clicking Start Scan
After animation, measurement cards for Shoulder, Chest, Waist, and Height appear with values
Recommended size card clearly shows 'Your Ideal Size: M'
Recommended size is stored in global/shared state accessible by the Shop page

file_operations.description: Create Body Scan AI page component with a simulated camera UI frame using the generated body-scan-illustration.dim_400x600.png image from frontend/public/assets/generated/body-scan-illustration.dim_400x600.png. Include a 'Start Scan' button with glow effect. On click, play a 2-3 second scan animation (pulsing scan line or ring overlay using CSS keyframes). After animation completes, display measurement cards for Shoulder (e.g., 18in), Chest (e.g., 40in), Waist (e.g., 32in), and Height (e.g., 5'10") using mock values. Show a recommended size result card: 'Your Ideal Size: M'. Store the recommended size ('M') in shared app state context so Shop page can access it. Apply glassmorphism styling to all cards.

requirements.summary: Build Wardrobe AI Page with simulated wardrobe scanning interface and analytics dashboard showing tops/jeans count and color distribution chart
acceptanceCriteria: Wardrobe scan interface renders with animated camera or upload zone
After scan trigger, analytics dashboard appears with tops count, jeans count, and color chart
Color distribution chart renders correctly with mock data (at least 4-5 colors)
Wardrobe state is stored globally and accessible by the Shop page for ownership warnings

file_operations.description: Create Wardrobe AI page component with a simulated wardrobe scanning interface using the generated wardrobe-icon.dim_128x128.png image from frontend/public/assets/generated/wardrobe-icon.dim_128x128.png as part of the camera frame or upload zone. Include a 'Start Scan' button. On click, play a short scan animation, then display an analytics dashboard showing: count of tops owned (e.g., 12), count of jeans owned (e.g., 5), and a color distribution chart (use a simple bar or donut chart library or SVG) with mock data for 4-5 colors (e.g., pink: 5, blue: 3, black: 2, white: 2). Store wardrobe data (tops count, jeans count, color breakdown) in shared app state so Shop page can check for duplicate warnings. Apply glassmorphism styling to dashboard cards.

requirements.summary: Create shared global app state (React Context) to store trial cart items, body scan recommended size, and wardrobe analytics data
acceptanceCriteria: Trial cart state is shared between Shop and Trial Hub pages
Body scan recommended size is accessible in Shop for warning popups
Wardrobe data is accessible in Shop for ownership duplicate warnings
State does not reset when navigating between pages within the session

file_operations.description: Create a React Context (AppContext) that provides global state for: (1) trialCartItems (array of selected products with sizes, max 5), (2) bodyScanRecommendedSize (string, e.g., 'M'), (3) wardrobeData (object with tops count, jeans count, color distribution). Provide setter functions for each state. Export AppProvider component and useAppContext hook. Use useState to manage state (persists within session, no localStorage required).
Import AppProvider from contexts/AppContext and wrap the entire app (including router) with AppProvider to make global state accessible across all pages.
